front.title: PROBE: A Utility For Probing Interfaces

abstract.t: This document describes a network diagnostic tool called PROBE. PROBE is similar to PING, in that it can be used to test the status of a probed interface. It differs from PING in that it does not require bidirectional connectivity between the probing and probed interfaces. Alternatively, PROBE requires bidirectional connectivity between the probing interface and a proxy interface. The proxy interface can reside on the same node as the probed interface or it can reside on a node to which the probed interface is directly connected. This document updates RFC 4884.
